Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of EC-IC Bypass in AICAO Patients

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants with recurrent hemispheric ischemia (rHEMI+) and without (rHEMI−) were randomised

Participants.evidence: Participants with recurrent hemispheric ischemia (rHEMI+) and without (rHEMI−)

Intervention.evidence: randomised to receive either EC-IC bypass surgery or medical management

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the incidence of all stroke and death from randomisation through 30 days and ipsilateral ischemic stroke within 2 years

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed

Blinding.evidence: Due to the nature of the intervention, blinding was not feasible

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 195 participants were randomised

Number_Analysed.evidence: The analysis was conducted on an intention-to-treat basis

Result_Outcome.evidence: No significant differences in the primary endpoint were found between surgical and nonsurgical groups in rHEMI+ (26.3% vs 22.4%, P = .660) and rHEMI− (18.9% vs 19.5%, P = .943)
